This peaceful village sits just 20 minutes from spectacular coastline yet maintains a tranquil, local character that escapes the bustle of major tourist zones. The area enjoys a spectacular Mediterranean climate with warm, dry summers and mild winters—ideal for year-round holidays. Surrounded by natural beauty including pine forests, coastal paths, and rolling agricultural landscapes, La Romana offers the perfect balance between beach access and countryside serenity. The region has become increasingly popular with international buyers seeking genuine Spanish experiences combined with modern conveniences, creating a welcoming, established expat community while preserving local traditions and authentic village life.

The established international community here speaks English widely, making daily life comfortable for holiday home owners and permanent residents alike. Weekly farmers' markets showcase fresh local produce, while nearby supermarkets including Mercadona and Lidl cater to all shopping needs. The village atmosphere encourages leisurely café culture, with local restaurants serving fresh seafood and traditional Spanish cuisine just minutes away. Healthcare is excellent with English-speaking doctors available and a regional hospital within 30 minutes for peace of mind. The location puts you perfectly positioned for weekend beach trips to Blue Flag beaches, rounds at championship golf courses, or exploring charming coastal towns. Yet after sunset, you return to your peaceful villa retreat, where the real magic happens—quality time with family and friends in your own private Mediterranean sanctuary.
investmentSection: This villa represents compelling investment value in one of Costa Blanca's most desirable emerging areas. At €2,957/m², you're acquiring premium specification at 40% below comparable island market prices, with the region experiencing steady 8% year-on-year property appreciation. Rental potential is significant—typical holiday lets command €800+ per week, generating potential annual returns of €35,000+ with just seasonal lettings. La Romana's authenticity, combined with improving accessibility and growing international awareness, positions it perfectly for continued value growth. The massive plot size opens additional income possibilities through careful development or long-term land appreciation. Whether as a personal retreat generating seasonal income or a longer-term investment vehicle, this property offers multiple pathways to value creation in a region experiencing increasing buyer interest.

At €340,000, you're acquiring a premium property with investment fundamentals, rental income potential, and personal holiday home possibilities that most buyers only dream about. La Romana offers the perfect balance—genuine Spanish village life with English-speaking community support, beach access within 20 minutes, year-round sunshine, and a cost of living that stretches your budget further than anywhere in the UK. Whether you're seeking a second home for summer escapes, a rental investment generating consistent income, or your eventual Mediterranean retirement destination, this villa delivers exceptional versatility. A modern regional hospital sits within 30 minutes, offering emergency services and specialized departments. Prescription medications are readily available through Spanish pharmacies at significantly lower costs than UK prices. Travel insurance and private health coverage are affordable options for holiday home owners, with many providers offering seamless European coverage.

faqs.question: Wie viel kostet diese Immobilie?
faqs.answer: €340,000. This 2-bedroom villa with 10,227m² plot offers exceptional value at €2,957/m²—approximately 40% below comparable Spanish island markets. Flexible payment options and mortgage arrangements are available for qualified international buyers.

faqs.question: Können Ausländer Immobilien in Spanien kaufen?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-EU and EU foreigners have the same property purchase rights as Spanish citizens. You'll need an NIE (Spanish tax identification number), which takes 10-15 minutes to obtain at your local police station. Most transactions proceed smoothly with proper legal representation, which we recommend.

faqs.question: Welche Kosten fallen beim Immobilienkauf in Spanien an?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect 6-8% in total acquisition costs including 3% transfer tax, 1.5% property registration, legal fees (1-2%), and surveyor costs. Mortgage arrangements typically cost 0.5-1% in origination fees. Annual property tax is approximately 0.4-1.1% of property value. Our legal team provides transparent cost breakdowns before proceeding.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Grundsteuern in Spanien?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) on this villa is approximately €120-180 depending on municipal assessment, making it highly affordable compared to UK council tax. Capital gains tax applies only if you sell at profit, calculated on the appreciation amount rather than full sale price. Non-resident property owners pay slightly higher rates but still very reasonable by international standards.

faqs.question: Kann ich als Ausländer eine Hypothek in Spanien bekommen?
faqs.answer: Yes, many Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign buyers, typically up to 80% of property value at competitive rates currently around 3-4%. You'll need proof of income, employment history, and credit documentation. Alternatively, many UK buyers use Spanish mortgages for their favorable rates or UK mortgages through lenders offering Spanish property financing. We connect you with experienced mortgage advisors.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Lebenshaltungskosten an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Living costs are 25-35% lower than comparable UK areas. Groceries cost significantly less through Spanish supermarkets, dining out averages €12-18 per person, and utilities run approximately 40% less than UK equivalents. Healthcare, entertainment, and transport are all substantially cheaper, making holiday home retirement or extended stays highly affordable.

faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca gut für Rentner?
faqs.answer: Absolutely—Costa Blanca attracts thousands of British retirees seeking warm climate, affordable living, excellent healthcare, and established English-speaking communities. Spain's non-lucrative visa program supports retirees with modest income requirements. Many retirees appreciate the ability to generate holiday rental income from their properties while enjoying permanent Mediterranean residence, maximizing both lifestyle and financial benefits.

faqs.question: Wie ist das Wetter an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Exceptional. The region enjoys 320+ days of annual sunshine with average temperatures of 17°C in winter and 28°C in summer. Mediterranean breezes keep humidity moderate, and rainfall is minimal (200mm annually). The consistent, mild climate makes year-round holiday use and outdoor living realistic, with no need to escape winter like northern Europe.

faqs.question: Is this villa suitable as a holiday rental property?
faqs.answer: Yes, excellent. The two-bedroom configuration suits couples, small families, or friends sharing costs. At €800+ weekly during peak season, projected annual rental income could exceed €35,000 with seasonal lettings. La Romana's growing reputation and proximity to beaches make it increasingly attractive to holiday renters seeking authentic village character combined with beach access.

faqs.question: What makes La Romana different from other Costa Blanca towns?
faqs.answer: La Romana maintains genuine Spanish village character while offering all modern conveniences—it hasn't been overwhelmed by tourism development. The established international community speaks English widely, yet local Spanish culture remains authentic. You get beach proximity combined with peaceful countryside living, avoiding the commercialized feel of major coastal resorts while accessing everything you need for comfortable living.
